alert.note: Alert for Lower Yampa River Basin; Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 6:35PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Rio Blanco and southeastern Uintah Counties through 700 PM MDT... At 634 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 35 miles southwest of Rangely, or 46 miles southeast of Fort Duchesne, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of west central Rio Blanco and southeastern Uintah Counties. This includes Colorado 139 near mile marker 50. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Lower Yampa River Basin; Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus
